Description: Intact pottery unburnished unguentarium with a light slip applied; flat base; rim painted with a dark red band; minor damage to the rim. Fine pink-orange fabric with mica and white and black or burnt inclusions
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Bolton Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Parallels from Naukratis (Nottingham NCM 1888-13; Ashmolean AN1896-1908-G.1049; Bolton 1966.113; Bristol, City Art Gallery & Museum H2224). 3rd to 2nd century BC parallels from Hadra, Alexandria (Enklaar 1998, 23, fig.20). Enklaar, A. 1998. Preliminary report on the pottery found at Hadra station, in Empereur, J-Y. (ed.), Commerce et Artisant dans l’Alexandrie Hellénistique et Romaine, Paris, 15-24.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.010) (Phase 3)
